com.facebook.buck.util

Class LineIterating

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.util.LineIterating

  • public final class LineIterating
extends Object
    Utility class to iterate over the lines present in one or more input strings, buffers, or arrays given a LineHandler callback.

    Whenever possible, the input buffer is directly passed back to your LineHandler callback (with adjusted position and limit), to avoid copies and allocations.

    If a line spans more than one input buffer or string, this class will handle concatenating data until an end-of-line is reached (or the LineHandler is closed).

    Supports Unix end-of-line (\n), Windows end-of-line (\r\n), and Mac end-of-line (\r).

    See Also:
    LineIterating.CharLineHandler, LineIterating.ByteLineHandler

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LineIterating.ByteLineHandler
      Stateful callback handler passed to iterateByLines(byte[], ByteLineHandler) and iterateByLines(ByteBuffer, ByteLineHandler).
      static class  LineIterating.CharLineHandler
      Stateful callback handler passed to iterateByLines(CharSequence, CharLineHandler) and iterateByLines(CharBuffer, CharLineHandler).

      static void iterateByLines(CharSequence str, LineIterating.CharLineHandler lineHandler)

    • Method Detail

      • iterateByLines

        public static void iterateByLines(CharSequence str,
                                  LineIterating.CharLineHandler lineHandler)
        Iterates over an input string by lines, invoking your implementation of LineHandler#handleLine(Buffer) once for each line in the input.

        If your input contains long lines split across multiple strings, you can call this method more than once, passing the same LineIterating.CharLineHandler to each invocation.

        Parameters:
        str - Input string containing zero or more lines to be iterated.
        lineHandler - Callback to be invoked with each line present in str.

      • iterateByLines

        public static void iterateByLines(CharBuffer buffer,
                                  LineIterating.CharLineHandler lineHandler)
        Iterates over an input CharBuffer by lines, invoking your implementation of LineHandler#handleLine(Buffer) once for each line in the input.

        If your input contains long lines split across multiple buffers, you can call this method more than once, passing the same LineIterating.CharLineHandler to each invocation.

        Consumes the entire buffer, starting at its current position. After returning, its position is set to its limit.

        Parameters:
        buffer - Input character buffer containing zero or more lines to be iterated.
        lineHandler - Callback to be invoked with each line present in buffer.

      • iterateByLines

        public static void iterateByLines(byte[] bytes,
                                  LineIterating.ByteLineHandler lineHandler)
        Iterates over an input byte array by lines, invoking your implementation of LineIterating.LineHandler.handleLine(Buffer) once for each line in the input. If your input contains long lines split across multiple byte arrays, you can call this method more than once, passing the same LineIterating.ByteLineHandler to each invocation.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Input byte array containing zero or more lines to be iterated.
        lineHandler - Callback to be invoked with each line present in bytes.

      • iterateByLines

        public static void iterateByLines(ByteBuffer buffer,
                                  LineIterating.ByteLineHandler lineHandler)
        Iterates over an input ByteBuffer by lines, invoking LineIterating.LineHandler.handleLine(Buffer) once for each line in the input.

        If your input contains long lines split across multiple byte arrays, you can call this method more than once, passing the same LineIterating.ByteLineHandler to each invocation.

        Consumes the entire buffer, starting at its current position. After returning, its position is set to its limit.

        Parameters:
        buffer - Input byte buffer containing zero or more lines to be iterated.
        lineHandler - Callback to be invoked with each line present in bytes.
